sentences.english: Am I a small political wunderkind ?
He had once been famous, a child prodigy, but now he was down and out.
sentences.chinese: 曾是名神童，非常出名，但现在穷困潦倒。

sentences.english: I have never witnessed such a wonder child as he.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没有见过像他那样的神童。

sentences.english: She retained the passion and quickness of a wunderkind .
sentences.chinese: 她仍保持着神童的激情与敏捷。

sentences.english: So they sent me to a school for gifted children.
sentences.chinese: 于是他们把我送到了一所为神童开办的学校。

sentences.english: In his drunken enthusiasm, Melchior conceived the idea of creating a musical prodigy.
sentences.chinese: 在酒后的狂热中，他动了要创造一个音乐神童的念头。

sentences.english: AC Milan wunderkind, Alexandre Pato recently reaffirmed his commitment to the Rossoneri after he pledged to remain true to his current contract.
sentences.chinese: 米兰神童帕托日前刚刚表示过会遵守合同，留守米兰。

sentences.english: In France, he's the " five billion whizz-kid".
sentences.chinese: 在法国，他却是“五十亿天才神童”。

sentences.english: Small child prodigy ice cream egg rolls.
We read about child prodigies in newspapers and magazines.
sentences.chinese: 我们从报刊杂志上讲到有关神童的报道。

sentences.english: IT IS rare to come upon a child prodigy in art collecting.
sentences.chinese: 艺术收藏界的神童实属罕见。

definition: being bright at an early age does not necessarily bring success upon growing up (proverb)
pinyin: xiao3 shi2 liao3 liao3 , da4 wei4 bi4 jia1

definition: high in score but low in ability (as a result of teaching to the test)
without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent

top scorer in the palace examination (highest rank of the Imperial examination system)/see 榜眼[bang3 yan3] and 探花[tan4 hua1]/top scorer in college entrance examination 高考[gao1 kao3]/(fig.) the most brilliantly talented person in the field/leading light
an outstanding talent (idiom)/surpassing insight and acumen
